result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon A. Rodgers

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.    Preliminary hearing is set for 10-31-22 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.
Attorney Joseph Pozorski, III is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 09-01-22.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 08-29-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

2:29 pm -  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shannon A. Rodgers in court. Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender. 
Initial appearance is reset to 07-25-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.
Initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
RE:  Purchase Pseudoephedrine for another with intent to manufacture methamphetamine, on 11-11-21.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 6 counts purchase pseudoephedrine on behalf of another to manufacture methamphetamine.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-27-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Attorney Larson objects to a bail hearing being held before a complaint is filed.  Court notes the objection but will proceed.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that eh have no contact with Nicholas Bevan and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.    Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
